name: libffi
description:
The libffi library provides a portable, high level programming interface
to various calling conventions. This allows a programmer to call any
function specified by a call interface description at run time.

dependent_to.name: librsvg
dependent_to.description: Library to render SVG files using Cairo

dependent_to.name: py-pygobject
dependent_to.description: bindings for the GLib, and GObject, to be used in Python.

dependent_to.name: llvm-doe
dependent_to.description:
This package provides a collection of the experimental LLVM projects
done by the US DOE research and development teams.

dependent_to.name: wayland
dependent_to.description:
Wayland is a project to define a protocol for a compositor to talk to
its clients as well as a library implementation of the protocol. The
compositor can be a standalone display server running on Linux kernel
modesetting and evdev input devices, an X application, or a wayland
client itself. The clients can be traditional applications, X
servers(rootless or fullscreen) or other display servers.

dependent_to.name: mozjs
dependent_to.description:
SpiderMonkey is Mozilla's JavaScript engine written in C/C++. It is used
in various Mozilla products, including Firefox, and is available under
the MPL2.

dependent_to.name: ruby
dependent_to.description:
A dynamic, open source programming language with a focus on simplicity
and productivity.

dependent_to.name: py-pygtk
dependent_to.description: bindings for the Gtk2 in Python. use pygobject for Gtk3.

dependent_to.name: py-pythonsollya
dependent_to.description: Python wrapper for the Sollya library

dependent_to.name: llvm-openmp-ompt
dependent_to.description:
The OpenMP subproject provides an OpenMP runtime for use with the OpenMP
implementation in Clang. This branch includes experimental changes for
OMPT, the OpenMP Tools interface

dependent_to.name: python
dependent_to.description: The Python programming language.

dependent_to.name: glib
dependent_to.description:
GLib provides the core application building blocks for libraries and
applications written in C. The GLib package contains a low-level
libraries useful for providing data structure handling for C,
portability wrappers and interfaces for such runtime functionality as an
event loop, threads, dynamic loading and an object system.

dependent_to.name: atk
dependent_to.description:
ATK provides the set of accessibility interfaces that are implemented by
other toolkits and applications. Using the ATK interfaces, accessibility
tools have full access to view and control running applications.

dependent_to.name: rocm-openmp-extras
dependent_to.description: OpenMP support for ROCm LLVM.

dependent_to.name: py-cffi
dependent_to.description: Foreign Function Interface for Python calling C code

dependent_to.name: p11-kit
dependent_to.description:
p11-kit aims to solve problems with coordinating the use of PKCS #11 by
different components or libraries living in the same process, by
providing a way to load and enumerate PKCS #11 modules, as well as a
standard configuration setup for installing PKCS #11 modules in such a
way that they're discoverable.

dependent_to.name: aomp
dependent_to.description: llvm openmp compiler from AMD.

dependent_to.name: adios2
dependent_to.description:
The Adaptable Input Output System version 2, developed in the Exascale
Computing Program

dependent_to.name: guile
dependent_to.description:
Guile is the GNU Ubiquitous Intelligent Language for Extensions, the
official extension language for the GNU operating system.

dependent_to.name: llvm
dependent_to.description:
The LLVM Project is a collection of modular and reusable compiler and
toolchain technologies. Despite its name, LLVM has little to do with
traditional virtual machines, though it does provide helpful libraries
that can be used to build them. The name "LLVM" itself is not an
acronym; it is the full name of the project.

dependent_to.name: sublime-text
dependent_to.description: Sublime Text is a sophisticated text editor for code, markup and prose.

dependent_to.name: libpeas
dependent_to.description:
libpeas is a gobject-based plugins engine, and is targeted at giving
every application the chance to assume its own extensibility.

dependent_to.name: pango
dependent_to.description:
Pango is a library for laying out and rendering of text, with an
emphasis on internationalization. It can be used anywhere that text
layout is needed, though most of the work on Pango so far has been done
in the context of the GTK+ widget toolkit.
